meanings.sent1: I splosh water on the plants to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: The children love to splosh in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to splosh in the bathtub but ended up making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The waves splosh against the shore, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The chef sploshes the sauce onto the dish, adding a burst of flavor.

meanings.definition: A sound made by liquid splashing.
meanings.sent1: The splosh of the rain on the roof was calming.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud splosh as the rock fell into the pond.
meanings.sent3: The splosh of the water in the fountain sounded like music.
meanings.sent4: The splosh of the waterfall echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The splosh of the milk being poured into the glass was satisfying.

meanings.definition: A mess or splash of liquid.
meanings.sent1: She slipped on the splosh of juice on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The splosh of paint on the canvas added a pop of color.
meanings.sent3: The splosh of soup on his shirt made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The splosh of mud on the car needed a good wash.
meanings.sent5: The splosh of sauce on the plate made it look appetizing.
